intro: Tithymalopsis angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf tithymalopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
